description:
OS: CentOS 6.4
Version: openstack Grizzly

I installed the openstack with yum. And I created a network use this command:
    nova-manage network create ippool --bridge_interface=br100 192.168.0.0/24 1 250

When restart nova-compute service, I got an CRITICAL error:
2013-06-21 17:30:18 14836 INFO nova.compute.manager [-] Loading compute driver 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver'
2013-06-21 17:30:18 14836 AUDIT nova.service [-] Starting compute node (version 2012.2.3-1.el6)
2013-06-21 17:30:20 14836 CRITICAL nova [-] list index out of range

My nova.conf is:
...
# network
network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatDHCPManager
my_ip=10.66.21.59
fixed_range=192.168.0.0/24
flat_network_bridge=br100
cc_host=192.168.0.1
network_size=8
routing_source_ip=192.168.0.1
...

nova-api/nova-network service started OK. Only nova-compute crashed.
title: [nova-compute] list index out of range

comments.content:
OS: CentOS 6.4
Version: openstack Grizzly

I installed the openstack with yum. And I created a network use this command:
    nova-manage network create ippool --bridge_interface=br100 192.168.0.0/24 1 250

When restart nova-compute service, I got an CRITICAL error:
2013-06-21 17:30:18 14836 INFO nova.compute.manager [-] Loading compute driver 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver'
2013-06-21 17:30:18 14836 AUDIT nova.service [-] Starting compute node (version 2012.2.3-1.el6)
2013-06-21 17:30:20 14836 CRITICAL nova [-] list index out of range

My nova.conf is:
...
# network
network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatDHCPManager
my_ip=10.66.21.59
fixed_range=192.168.0.0/24
flat_network_bridge=br100
cc_host=192.168.0.1
network_size=8
routing_source_ip=192.168.0.1
...

nova-api/nova-network service started OK. Only nova-compute crashed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pengyuwei

comments.content: Do you have a paste bin of the stack trace around the index out of range error?  That is needed to know where this failed.  Are you running quantum at all?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
I use nova-network, not quantum.

I solved the problem.

First I created a vm failed, which status came into ERROR state.
I use 'nova delete xxxxx-xxxxx' to delete it, but it still there and I got no error. Then the nova-compute service got the 'index out of range' error and can't start.

After weekend, I try delete it again, this  time nova deleted the vm success.The nova-compute service started OK...

So , 'index out of range' maybe the vm id not in virsh list
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pengyuwei

comments.content:
Were you able to get the stack trace from the log from the 'list index out of range' error?

You said the problem went away but we can still investigate if you have the stack trace.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~melwitt

comments.content: Critical used to hide stack traces, we've fixed that fact. No idea what the original bug was, but at least we could address these in the future.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
